alert.note: Alert for Haskell (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 02 at 3:09PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Haskell and southwestern Sequoyah Counties through 345 PM CDT... At 309 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm near Stigler, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Sallisaw... Stigler... Vian... Tamaha... Mc Key... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 295 and 303. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for east central Oklahoma.
